text:
Mark Macias is a former Executive Producer with NBC, Senior Producer with CBS in New York and author of the book, Beat the Press: Your Guide to Managing the Media. He has worked on several high-profile news programs including 60 Minutes, Sunday Morning and 20/20.

| Mark Macias |
| Born |  (1967-02-23) February 23, 1967Hartford, Connecticut, US |
| Nationality | American |
| Alma mater | University of Maryland |
| Occupation(s) | Journalist, Author, Public Relations Expert |
| Website | maciaspr.com |

Macias has worked as an investigative producer for several prominent TV shows and was part of the production team that earned an Emmy Award nomination for Investigative Journalism. He also received a Peabody Award for his work on the documentary "The American Experience: The Two Nations of Black America."

In addition to his career in journalism, Macias has taught media relations at Columbia University's Graduate School of Journalism and has been quoted in numerous publications, including PRWeek, AdAge, and the NY Daily News.

## Early life and education

Macias was born in Hartford, Connecticut, on February 23, 1967. He graduated from the University of Maryland in 1989 with a Bachelor of Arts degree in Broadcast Journalism.

## Career

After graduating from college, Macias began his career in journalism as a researcher for ABC News' World News Tonight.
